newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria names Edlinger new finance minister.
newsitem.headline: Austria names Edlinger new finance minister.

text.p: Austria's chancellor-designate Viktor Klima on Friday named Rudolf Edlinger as the country's new finance minister, sources in the ruling Social Democratic party said.
Klima was finance minister until he was named chancellor after the resignation of Franz Vranitzky last Saturday.
The source, speaking on condition of anonymity, confirmed a report on Austrian state radio: "It's him."

Social Democrat Edlinger, 56, currently serves as the City of Vienna's finance councillor and has over the past week repeatedly been mentioned in Austrian media as a frontrunner for the key cabinet post.

Edlinger was among a team of senior leaders of Austria's coalition parties who two weeks ago hammered out a last-minute deal to sell flagship bank Creditanstalt to market leader Bank Austria, which is effectively controlled by the City of Vienna.
The conservative People's Party, the junior coalition partner of the Social Democrats, had objected to the sale to Bank Austria.
